title: Beginner English 105
headline: Learn English grammar, pronunciation and vocabulary relating to numbers, time and events with this free online course.
description: Do you find studying English challenging? This engaging course gives you the confidence to master the basics of telling time and planning events. We cover grammar, pronunciation, and vocabulary relating to these areas, including ‘prepositions of time,’ ‘what,’ or ‘when’ questions relating to time, and basic vocabulary to help you easily discuss events and make plans. Polish your English skills with this course and enroll today.
courseDescription:
This course is a building block that will help you widen your vocabulary and become more self-assured in expressing yourself and conversing in English. We begin this course by examining the pronunciation of words relating to time. This includes learning how to pronounce all the days of the week and the calendar months of a year.

The course then moves on to learning numbers. We compare ordinal numbers (like ‘first’ and ‘second’) to cardinal numbers (like ‘one’ and ‘two’) and explain when to use them. We then examine grammar relating to time. You will learn how to tell the time and how to read a clock in English. The course then discusses the ‘prepositions of time’ (‘in,’ ‘at,’ and ‘on’) and shows you when to use each correctly.

Our final section goes through vocabulary relating to events. We demonstrate how to add adjectives to add information and make the event-related word more specific. This course takes you through each section step-by-step, using video and audio clips to enhance your learning experience. Sign up today to help boost your confidence while speaking English.
